conclusion: Understand the v-t graph: x-axis is time, y-axis is velocity, slope gives acceleration.
Identify the relevant portion of the graph: time interval from 1 s to 3 s, straight line with negative slope.
At t = 1 s, velocity is 2 m/s; at t = 3 s, velocity is -2 m/s.
Calculate change in velocity: Δv = -4 m/s.
Calculate change in time: Δt = 2 s.
